name: reliever
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
something that makes something unpleasant less strong or less unpleasant: a pain/stress reliever a reliever of boredom
a drug used to treat acute (= sudden and bad) asthma (= a condition that makes breathing difficult): Relievers work rapidly to open up airways and help breathing. Make sure your child knows to have their reliever inhaler with them at all times.
in baseball, a pitcher (= a player who throws the ball to the player with the bat) who comes on to play instead of another pitcher: He pitched in 45 games, mostly as a reliever.
More examplesFewer examplesFor many, the pressure reliever of choice is alcohol.The body's own cortisone is a potent reliever of inflammation and pain.She felt she was just there for his amusement, as a reliever of boredom.Specific treatments for asthma are broadly classified as relievers, preventers and emergency treatment.Reliever Ray King was on the mound.
